00014 #ifndef ULIB_RPC_FAULT_H
00015 #define ULIB_RPC_FAULT_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/string.h>
00018 
00023 class U_EXPORT URPCFault {
00024 public:
00025 
00026         // Check for memory error
00027         U_MEMORY_TEST
00028 
00029         // Allocator e Deallocator
00030         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00031         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00032 
00033         enum FaultCode { Sender, Receiver, DataEncodingUnknown, MustUnderstand, VersionMismatch };
00034 
00035         static UString* str_encode;
00036         static UString* str_sender;
00037         static UString* str_receiver;
00038         static UString* str_MustUnderstand;
00039         static UString* str_VersionMismatch;
00040         static UString* str_DataEncodingUnknown;
00041 
00042         static void str_allocate();
00043 
00044         // COSTRUTTORI
00045 
00046         URPCFault() : detail(U_CAPACITY)
00047                 {
00048                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCFault, "", 0)
00049 
00050                 faultCode = Sender;
00051 
00052                 if (str_sender == 0) str_allocate();
00053                 }
00054 
00055         virtual ~URPCFault()
00056                 {
00057                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, URPCFault)
00058                 }
00059 
00060         // SERVICES
00061 
00062         // Gets the general reason why the call failed.
00063         // Returns a string combining the generic fault and any more specific fault data
00064 
00065         UString getFaultCode();
00066 
00067         // Sets the generic fault code
00068 
00069         void setFaultCode(FaultCode code = Receiver) { faultCode = code; }
00070 
00071         // Allows the caller to set the generic and specific reasons for the failure of a call
00072 
00073         void setDetail()
00074                 {
00075                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCFault::setDetail()")
00076 
00077                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(u_buffer_len, 0)
00078 
00079                 detail.snprintf("%.*s", u_buffer_len, u_buffer);
00080 
00081                 u_buffer_len = 0;
00082                 }
00083 
00084         void setDetail(const char* format, ...);
00085 
00086         UString& getDetail()      { return detail; }
00087         UString& getFaultReason() { return faultReason; }
00088 
00089         // Encodes the complete fault into a string
00090 
00091         virtual void encode(UString& response)
00092                 {
00093                 U_TRACE(0, "URPCFault::encode(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(response))
00094 
00095                 UString code = getFaultCode();
00096 
00097                 response.setBuffer(str_encode->size() +
00098                                                                  code.size()              +
00099                                                                  faultReason.size() +
00100                                                                  detail.size());
00101 
00102                 response.snprintf(str_encode->data(), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(code),
00103                                                                                                                   U_STRING_TO_TRACE(faultReason),
00104                                                                                                                   (detail.empty() ? "" : " - "),
00105                                                                                                                   U_STRING_TO_TRACE(detail));
00106                 }
00107 
00108         // DEBUG
00109 
00110 #ifdef DEBUG
00111         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00112 #endif
00113 
00114 protected:
00115         UString detail,         // Details behind why the fault occurred
00116                           faultReason;    // Description of the fault
00117         FaultCode faultCode;    // Generic reason the call failed
00118 
00119 private:
00120         URPCFault(const URPCFault&)            {}
00121         URPCFault& operator=(const URPCFault&) { return *this; }
00122 };
00123 
00124 #endif
